title: Hungary's Orban defies EU by promising Putin to keep buying Russian oil
subhead: In a meeting at the Kremlin with the Russian president on Friday, Viktor Orban said that 'energy supplies from Russia form the basis of Hungary's energy supply now and will remain so in the future.'

subhead: This week, the Paris criminal court examined the issue at the heart of the much-anticipated Lafarge case: the payments made to terrorist groups from 2012 to 2014.

title: Georgia's despondency after a year of protest against the pro-Russian regime
subhead: The protest movement triggered by the halt in Georgia's EU integration now faces an unyielding government. With its top leaders jailed, the opposition warns that the country is sliding into outright authoritarian rule.

title: Four reasons French winegrowers are angry
subhead: Wine production in 2025 is expected to match that of 2024, which was already a disastrous year. Le Monde examines the four main factors behind this downturn.

title: Germany's pension reform becomes a generational conflict
